wisdom: Remember to thank Allah for the joy you feel, as it is a blessing from Him. Allah says, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]' (Qur'an 14:7).
When you feel sad, remember Allah’s promise: 'Verily, with hardship comes ease' (Qur'an 94:6). Hold onto patience, and seek comfort in Salah and du'a.
In times of worry, remind yourself of Allah’s protection and that He is the best disposer of affairs. Allah says, 'And whoever relies upon Allah – then He is sufficient for him' (Qur'an 65:3).

Gratitude brings contentment. Reflect on Allah’s blessings, and as Allah says, 'And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them' (Qur'an 14:34).
When feeling alone, remember Allah is with you. He says, 'And We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein' (Qur'an 50:16). Seek comfort in His presence and remembrance.
When in fear, turn to Allah for He is the Protector. Allah says, 'Allah is the best protector, and He is the most merciful of the merciful' (Qur'an 12:64).

When feeling disappointed, trust in Allah's wisdom. Remember, 'It may be that you dislike a thing which is good for you and that you like a thing which is bad for you. Allah knows and you do not know' (Qur'an 2:216).
Hope is a blessing, and Allah loves those who have a positive outlook. Allah says, 'Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good' (Qur'an 7:56).

In anger, the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) advised us to seek refuge in Allah and control our speech and actions. 'The strong person is not the one who can wrestle others, but the one who controls himself when angry' (Hadith).

In times of confusion, remember that Allah guides those who seek His help. Make du'a for guidance, as the Prophet (peace be upon him) taught: 'O Allah, show me the truth as truth and grant me the ability to follow it.'
When exhausted, rely on Allah’s strength. Allah says, 'And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die' (Qur'an 25:58). Take time to rest and recharge.

When feeling inspired, act with intention to please Allah. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said, 'The best of people are those who are most beneficial to people.' Let this inspiration lead to good deeds.
When relieved, remember Allah's kindness in removing distress. Allah says, 'And when harm touches you upon the sea, those that you call upon besides Him are lost from you' (Qur'an 17:67).
